text: alt text = "Molly's father doesn't trust any technology that yields to a kick."

text: That's a Cowboy Bebop reference, right? Chubs.

text: Those dents on the swordfish didn't come from racing, you know. Chubs.

name: soticoto
text:
You are now my personal hero.

Impregnate me in the man-gina.

name: tekende
text: You have a downstairs mix-up?

name: capslock_annliv
text: chubbied so hard

name: soticoto
text: Negatory. The man-gina is the male back-passage when dominant cock is inserted in it.

name: torpor
text: This is either the most amazing or the most idiotic thing I have ever read. I think it's both.

name: sargasm
text: So, the idea is that her dad is 300 years old, and dead, and Welsh, right?  It is never easy meeting her dad.

name: neonfreon
text: maybe molly is a scottish fold?

name: shutup_shutup
text:
She must be a Manx 'cause she got no tail .

Sorry. That was really uncalled for. Sorry. You're welcome.

name: woodenteeth
text:
I don't know. I live 40 minutes drive from my girl's Dad. All Beef has to do is drop off to sleep.

Imagine the consequences... when you drift off to sleep through that bright post-coital haze and your girl's dad's face is grimacing on the other side.

Two words: Associative Disorder .

name: skiddyfisk
text: I believe the CARTOON CAT is experiencing a Dream.

name: zaratustra
text: he's havin' a Fantasy.

name: jrizzle
text: Thus spoke zaratustra.

name: jackparsons
text: Spake.

name: cailetshadow
text: correcting 'spoke' to 'spake' must be a particularly satisfying spelling correction.

name: stereo
text: Especially considering it's a translation, and either way is correct (of Also sprach Zarathustra)

name: rogergs
text: The clock currently tends to find Roast Beef at a quarter past Mountain Dew.

name: umbra
text: a "lightnin' box" is a brilliant name for a computer.

text: Poor Roast Beef! He slept on her dad's ghost's bad side, and now he is going to end up with acid tummy .

text: A comment left by neonfreon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by equinn2006, shogun, sarabria, suprememongoose)

name: grayfox
text: Probably from something thats in the public domain now.  Like "Old Yeller".  Or a 1920s silent production of "Uncle Toms Cabin".

name: eatmorekix
text: looks like the set from a john ford movie. i'm thinking "the searchers".

name: straw
text: I thought Ford too, but more "How Green Was My Valley."

name: pyromancer
text: Dad should rethink.  There might be some money in masonry (real stone goes to high end consumers) but Beef'll get silicosis for sure.

name: featurelessvoid
text: But beware, lad!  That lightnin' box'll give ye carpal tunnel every time.  Ol' Phineas down in the IT department caught the carpal tunnel, and it were the death of 'im.

name: dwilow
text:
That's it! Not only do masons run the country, but now they're calling the shots in Achewood?

This is the last straw. See you guys on the 6 o'clock news.

name: borneo8
text: A comment left by borneo8 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stopeatingmyeyes, Marcus_Brody, Hendetta)

name: benjaminpask
text: i thought the road to matrimony was a little too smooth... but, yeah, there's hella money in stone, and at least old man sanders ain't sending him down the coal mines. Black lung puts the boot into silicosis.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Ye can trust a man who werks with stone, his mind be allus focused on the task o' makin' sure his hands dinnae get crushed.

name: hendetta
text: A comment left by hendetta was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mortshire, Dwilow, Mastronaut)

name: dhinson
text: When did Roast Beef and Molly swap the pepsi can lamp for the IKEA one?

name: featurelessvoid
text: Probably when they moved into Ray's pool house.  It's a problem that plagues working-class neighborhoods nationwide: as soon as the computer programmers move into your pool house, they start to gentrify the place.

name: jackparsons
text: My grandfather grew up in coal-mining Scotland and came to the US shoveling coal in the bottom of a ship. I earn a living with a lightnin' box. I really don't want any dreams like this.

name: fosters
text:
When I first saw this strip I didn't pay much attention to the title or the alt text, so I had no idea who this was.

"Huh, the Ghost of Christmas Extremely Past is giving Roast Beef career advice. Ok, that makes as much sense as anything else I've seen in this strip."

name: hereward
text:
Molly's dad is hardcore, but he doesn't sound very welsh. Onstad's usual good accent skills did not perform on this occasion.

Stone is still part of the character of the UK, my dad was saying only today that most houses you see still have a little store of good stones just in case we need them.

name: puguglypress
text:
I LOVE finding comics I haven't read!

Especially these days, when the comics are late and/or aren't that great.

Five'd.
